title: 2026 Asian Games
text:
The 2026 Asian Games (), also known as XX Asiad () and Aichi-Nagoya 2026, will be a <a href="multi-sport%20event">multi-sport event</a> celebrated in the <a href="Aichi%20Prefecture">Aichi Prefecture</a> and its capital <a href="Nagoya">Nagoya</a> in Japan from 19 September to 4 October 2026. Nagoya will be the third Japanese city to host the Games, after <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a> in <a href="1958%20Asian%20Games">1958</a> and <a href="Hiroshima">Hiroshima</a> in <a href="1994%20Asian%20Games">1994</a>.
Bidding process.
The <a href="Olympic%20Council%20of%20Asia">Olympic Council of Asia</a> (OCA) selected Nagoya to host the Games at their annual general assembly session in <a href="Danang">Danang</a>, Vietnam, on September 25, 2016. The bid was initially in threat of falling apart after a budget dispute between <a href="Aichi%20Prefecture">Aichi Prefecture</a> and its capital Nagoya, but was resolved, allowing the bid to be accepted. The OCA originally planned to choose the 2026 host city in 2018, but brought the planning date forward due to the intensity of the region's sporting calendar, including the next three <a href="Winter%20Olympic%20Games">Winter Olympic Games</a> between 2018, 2022 and 2026.
Development and preparations.
Costs.
The city of Nagoya received an estimate of roughly ¥85 billion in costs from the Aichi Prefecture government for the event, 30% of which is expected to be covered by sponsorships and other revenue, while the remainder is planned to be split on a 70–30 basis between Nagoya and Aichi Prefecture.
Venues.
The Games are planned to use existing facilities. <a href="Paloma%20Mizuho%20Stadium">Paloma Mizuho Stadium</a> will host both the opening and closing ceremonies and <a href="Sport%20of%20athletics">athletics</a>, <a href="Nippon%20Gaishi%20Hall">Nippon Gaishi Hall</a> Complex is to be used for both <a href="gymnastics">gymnastics</a> and <a href="List%20of%20water%20sports">aquatics</a>, the <a href="Nagoya%20Dome">Nagoya Dome</a> is to be used for <a href="baseball">baseball</a>, and the <a href="Toyota%20Stadium%20%28Japan%29">Toyota Stadium</a> is to be used for <a href="association%20football">football</a>.
